metadata.title: CVE-2022-4283 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This security flaw occurs because theXkbCopyNames function left a dangling pointer to freed memory, resulting inout-of-bounds memory access on subsequent XkbGetKbdByName requests.. Thisissue can lead to local privileges elevation on systems where the X serveris running privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwardingsessions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-common - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
xvfb - 2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.5-1ubuntu1').
xwayland package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.6-1').
